properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Figtree Drive at Australia Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Olympic Park NSW Health Vaccination Centres – transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Olympic Park NSW Health Vaccination Centres – transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Sydney Olympic Park is located at 1 Figtree Drive. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 7pm, Monday to Saturday. 

Free parking is available at P3 car park on Sarah Durack Ave for those with vaccination appointments. Follow the signs to navigate the short walk to the centre, alternatively a shuttle bus will run to the centre approximately every 20 minutes.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Australia Ave, Underwood Rd and Hill Rd, and follow the directions of traffic control and staff on site.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - BELMONT Pacific Highway near Floraville Road, Floraville
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Belmont is located at the former Bunnings site at 393 Pacific Hwy. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 6:45pm daily Monday to Friday, and from 8am to 2:45pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct particularly during the morning and evening peak. 

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY CBD Pitt Street at King Street, Sydney
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in the Sydney CBD is located at 175 Pitt St and is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 8pm on Monday to Friday, and from 8am to 4pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct particularly during the morning and evening peak. 

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - MACQUARIE FIELDS Victoria Road at Brooks Street
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Macquarie Fields NSW Health Vaccination Centre - transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Macquarie Fields NSW Health Vaccination Centre - transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Macquarie Fields is located at Glenquarie Town Centre. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments from 8.30am to 6pm daily Monday to Saturday. Parking is available at James Meehan Oval, access via Parliament Road

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Victoria Rd, Canterbury Rd and Harold St, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - WOLLONGONG Crown Street at Church Street
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Wollongong is located at 163-177 Crown Street. The centre is in operation from 8am to 4:30pm daily, Monday to Sunday.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the centre including Crown St, Keira St, Church St and Burelli St, particularly during the morning and evening peak periods.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: Sydney Harbour 10k & 5k - Sunday 5 December - SYDNEY CBD, THE ROCKS, MILLERS POINT, BARANGAROO & PYRMONT George Street, Hickson Road, Pirrama Road
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney CBD & Pyrmont road closure map - Sydney Harbour 10k & 5k Sun 5 Dec 2021
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney CBD & Pyrmont road closure map - Sydney Harbour 10k & 5k Sun 5 Dec 2021

properties.otherAdvice:
Around 7,500 people will take part in the annual Sydney Harbour 10k and 5k. Events start from George St at the Overseas Passenger Terminal in The Rocks from 7am. The course travels around the harbour foreshore using on and off-road pathways via Dawes Point, Millers Point, Barangaroo, King St Wharf and Pyrmont. To safely facilitate the fun run road closures will be in place.

ROAD CLOSURES:

  • 4:30am to 10:30am: George St from Alfred St to Hickson Rd and Hickson Rd from George St to The Park Hyatt.
  • 4:30am to 12:30pm: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.
  • 5:30am to 9:30am: Sussex St northbound from King St to Erskine St, Sussex St between Napoleon St and Erskine St including Slip St and Hickson Rd from Watermans Quay to Napoleon St.
  • 5:30am to 10am: Hickson Rd between Watermans Quay and Town Pl, Hickson Rd southbound between Towns Place and the Park Hyatt, Napoleon St and Barton St.
  • 5:30am to 10:30am: Hickson Rd northbound from Towns Pl to The Park Hyatt, Dalgety Road and Towns Place.
  • 7am to 9:30am: Roads around Pyrmont including Murray St between Darling Dr and Pirrama Rd, Pirrama Rd between Murray St and Jones Bay Rd and Wharf 7 & 10 access roads
  • From 8am to 9am there will be no exit from Barangaroo Ave, Cuthbert St, King St, Lime St and Shelley St at King St Wharf due to closures on Sussex Street.

Changed local access arrangements will be in place in Pyrmont, King St Wharf and Barangaroo precincts.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will not be in effect however all vehicles, including cars and motorcycles, parked on roads that are closed for the event will not be able to move or exit the area until roads have safely reopened.

arrangementElements.html:
SYDNEY CBD / THE ROCKS

FROM 4:30AM TO 10:30AM

  • George Street Between Alfred Street and Hickson Road (Northbound)
  • Hickson Rd Between George St and Park Hyatt
  • Upper Roadway From Hickson Road to Overseas Passenger Terminal  

THE ROCKS

FROM 4:30AM to 12:30PM

  • Circular Quay West From Argyle Street  

BARANGAROO / DAWES POINT / MILLERS POINT

FROM 5:30AM to 9:30AM

  • Hickson Rd Between Watermans Quay and Napoleon St
  • Slip Street From Sussex Street
  • Sussex Street Between Napoleon Street and Erskine Street
  • Sussex Street Between King Street and Erskine Street (Northbound)

FROM 5:30AM TO 10:00AM

  • Barton St From Hickson Rd
  • Hickson Road Between Watermans Quay and Towns Place
  • Hickson Road Between Towns Place and Park Hyatt (Southbound)
  • Napoleon Street Between Kent Street and Sussex Street  

FROM 5:30AM to 10:30AM

  • Dalgety Road Between Windmill Street and Towns Place
  • Hickson Road Between Towns Place and Park Hyatt (Northbound)
  • Towns Place Between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road    

PYRMONT

FROM 7:00AM TO 09:30AM

  • Murray Street 1 Between Darling Drive and Pirrama Road
  • Pirrama Road 2 Between Murray Street and Jones Bay Road
  • Wharf 7 & 10 access road 3 From Pirrama Road

Notes:

  1. No access to or from Australian National Maritime Museum.
  2. Exit only from The Star carpark northbound on Pirrama Road. Access to Star Casino via Edward St.
  3. Exit only until 8.00am northbound on Pirrama Road.

CYCLEWAY CLOSURE

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8AM to 9AM

  • King Street 1 Between Kent Street and Sussex Street

Notes:

  1. Cycleway detour from Pyrmont Bridge to Kent Street and vice versa via Market Street road bridge.

 

SHARED PATHWAY CLOSURE - SYDNEY CBD

FROM 8AM to 9AM

  • King Street off ramp Between Pyrmont Bridge and Sussex Street pathway closed.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures &  shared pathway closures

arrangementElements.html:
CHANGED ACCESS ARRANGEMENTS DURING CLOSURE PERIODS:

King St Wharf: between 8am and 9am access to King St Wharf is via Wheat Road only. There will be no entry or exit via Erskine St during this time due to closures on Sussex St for the event. Vehicles entering the precinct need to be aware they cannot exit until after 9am when roads reopen. 

Pyrmont: between 7am and 9:30am access into The Star carpark will not be available via Pirrama Rd, access via Pyrmont St, Jones Bay Rd or Edward St instead. Vehicles may exit the carpark onto Pirrama Rd (northbound only) under traffic control until 8:45am. No access to or from Australian National Maritime Museum during these times.
arrangementElements.title: Local access arrangements

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Pirrama Road

webLinks.linkText: Bathurst 1000 road closures and changed traffic conditions

properties.headline: Bathurst 1000 - Tuesday 30 November to Sunday 5 December - BATHURST various roads incl Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy approaching Mount Panorama
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of motorsport fans are expected to attend the 2021 Repco Supercars Championship at Mount Panorama with 6 days of race track activity from Tuesday 30 November finishing with the Bathurst 1000 race from 12.15pm on Sunday 5 December.  

Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid-Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee. 

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct. 

On Monday 6 December as fans head home from Bathurst, traffic will be heavy along the Great Western Hwy towards Sydney with significant eastbound delays expected through the Blue Mountains. Traffic will also be heavy on the Mid Western Hwy approaching Cowra and the Mitchell Hwy towards Orange.

Changed traffic conditions including reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Hwy at Mount Victoria and the Mid Western Hwy at Cowra to manage traffic. 

On Saturday 4 December Russell St and Church St between William St and George St will be closed from 5am to 10pm to accommodate a street fair. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and particularly on Monday morning.
properties.displayName: Bathurst 1000 - Tuesday 30 November to Sunday 5 December

roads.mainStreet: various roads incl Great Western Hwy, Mitchell Hwy, Mid-Western Hwy

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 28 November - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Newcastle Jets at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 6.15pm, full-time around 8.10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium may be closed prior to full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Wings Over Illawarra Airshow - Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 November - ALBION PARK RAIL Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Catch trains to Albion Park Rail station across from the Airport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Wings Over Illawarra Airshow at Shellharbour Airport on Saturday and Sunday from 10:30am to 4:30pm each day.

Traffic may be heavy along the Princes Hwy and the M1 Princes Mwy with changed traffic conditions in place approaching the Oak Flats Interchange. Motorists are advised to take care and allow extra travel time in the area over the weekend.

From 12pm to 4.30pm on Saturday and from 10am to 4.30pm on Sunday the former Illawarra Hwy (Croome Ln) and Hargraves Ave will be closed to traffic.

From 7am to 6pm each day, Tongarra Rd will be under stop/slow at Croome Rd and Ash Ave.

Those attending the event are advised to catch public transport and are reminded that no general parking is available at Shellharbour Airport. If you're driving to the show use the Air Show Park & Ride carparks at Ash Ave and Croome Rd, near Tongarra Rd just south of the airport where free shuttle buses will run to and from the Air Show entrance.
properties.displayName: Wings Over Illawarra Airshow - Saturday 27 and Sunday 28 November

webLinks.linkText: i98 Illawarra Convoy Vantage point locations

properties.headline: Illawarra Convoy - Sunday 5 December - APPIN TO ALBION PARK via Appin Rd, Old Princes Hwy, Shellharbour Rd and Princes Hwy
properties.publicTransport: There will be no family fun day at Shellharbour Airport this year. Spectators can view the convoy along the 80km route at various locations.
properties.adviceB: Exercise caution; Allow extra travel time
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 800 trucks and 900 motorbikes will form part of the annual i98 Illawarra convoy travelling from Appin and Bulli Tops to finish near Shellharbour Airport in Albion Park. Motorbikes will leave from West Cliff Colliery, Appin from 8:15am, trucks will leave from Maddens Plains at 8.30am.

The convoy will travel via Appin Rd, Old Princes Hwy, M1 Princes Mwy, Masters Rd, Five Island Rd, Primbee bypass, Windang Rd, Shellharbour Rd, New Lake Entrance Rd and Princes Hwy. The convoy will finish at the Convoy shop, corner of Airport Rd and Princes Hwy instead of the Airport this year. Bikes will arrive from 9.15am and trucks from 10am.

Motorists may experience traffic delays along the M1 Princes Mwy at the Oak Flats Interchange while the convoy travels through the area. 

Speed reductions will be in effect at various times and locations between 4.30am and 3pm on sections of Appin Rd, M1 Princes Mwy, Princes Hwy and Tongarra Rd.

The right hand turn from Old Mount Ousley Rd onto the M1 Princes Mwy/Mount Ousley Rd will be closed between 7am and 12pm. The convoy will travel in one lane along the route. 

Motorists are advised to take care as they share roads with the convoy vehicles and allow extra travel time in the area while changed traffic conditions are in place.

arrangementElements.html:
APPIN, BULLI TOPS, OAK FLATS Speed reductions - Sunday 5 December 

  • Appin: speed limit will be reduced from 90km/h to 40km/h between 4:30am and 12pm midday along both directions of Appin Rd between Baden Powell Dr and Wedderburn Rd, Appin
  • Maddens Plains to Bulli Tops: speed limit will be reduced from 80km/h to 60km/h between 7am and 1:30pm on the southbound lanes of the M1 Princes Mwy from Maddens Plains to Bulli Tops
  • Oak Flats: Speed limit will be reduced from to 60km/h between 7am and 3pm approaching Oak Flats Interchange from Princes Hwy and East West Link Rd with New Lake Entrance Rd being reduced to 40kmh.
arrangementElements.title: Speed Reductions

roads.mainStreet: via Appin Rd, Old Princes Hwy, Shellharbour Rd and Princes Hwy

properties.headline: Cycle Event - Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 December - BOWRAL various roads incl Bong Bong Rd, Illawarra Hwy and Nowra Rd in the Southern Highlands
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 3,500 cyclists will take part in The Bowral Classic over two days this year Saturday 11 and Sunday 12 December. On Saturday riders will take part in a 50km gravel ride and race around Bowral.

On Sunday riders will take part in a 150km, 120km, 85km or 35km ride, starting from 6.30am on Bong Bong St in Bowral travelling south to Bundanoon or Robertson before returning to finish at Loseby Park in Bowral. Changed traffic arrangements and road closures will be in place 

Bong Bong St, Bowral will be closed between Banyette St and Wingecarribee St from 4am to 9am on Sunday. 

Other local roads in Bowral, Moss Vale and the Southern Highlands area will also close for the event. Local diversions will be in place:

Saturday

  • Bowral: From 8:30am until 8:30pm sections of Loseby St, Ascot St, Sheffield St and Park St will be closed. 

Sunday

  • Bowral: Between 4am and 4pm sections of Oxley Dr, Duke St, Park St, Station St, Wingecarribee St and Oxleys Hill Rd will be closed. 
  • Bundanoon: From 7:30am until 10:30am Ellsmore Rd northbound will be closed between Blue Gum Rd and Sallys Corner Road. 
  • Fitzroy Falls: Between 8:30am and 1pm sections of Nowra Rd, Myra Vale Rd and Pearsons Lane will be closed. 
  • Kangaloon: From 9am until 2:15pm Tourist Rd/Kirland Rd will be closed to southbound/eastbound traffic between Range Rd and Kangaloon Rd.
  • Glenquarry/Mittagong: From 9:30am until 2:30pm Range Rd will be closed to southbound/eastbound traffic between Old South Rd and Tourist Rd.

A speed limit reduction will be in effect along both directions of the Illawarra Hwy between Lackey Rd and Old Argyle Rd.

Stop/slow traffic control will be in place on sections of the Illawarra Hwy at Moss Vale, Nowra Rd at Fitzroy Falls and the Illawarra Hwy at Robertson. Motorists should allow extra time and expect some delays.

Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

arrangementElements.html:
BOWRAL

SATURDAY 11 DECEMBER

FROM 8:30AM TO 8:30PM

  • Loseby St, Ascot St & Sheffield St Resident Access Only. Park Rd will be Fully Closed.
  •  An “Event Clearway” will be in place on Park Rd, Loseby St, Ascot St & Sheffield St.There will be No Parking on these streets.

SUNDAY 12 DECEMBER

BETWEEN 9:15AM TO 3:15PM

  • Oxley Drive between Queen St and Duke St will be closed in both directions.
  • Local Resident Only access to Oxley Drive between Queen St and Rose St, including residents of Ellen St. Residents of Rose St, Hamilton Ave & Queen St, please access/exit via Merrigang St end.
  • Duke St (west) will be closed. Exit out of Duke St (East) end only.
  • Local Resident Only access to Oxley Drive between Duke St and Tyndall St. All residents exiting will need to travel towards Mittagong ONLY to exit.
  • Access to Oxley Drive from Morts Ln and Acacia St will be closed to exit out of Bracken St.

FROM 9:15AM TO 4PM

  •  Park Rd will be Fully Closed between Loseby St & Sheffield St. 

FROM 4AM TO 9AM

  • Bong Bong St between Banyette St and Merrigang St in both directions
  • Station St between Banyette St and Merrigang St in both directions
  • Wingecarribee St between Bong Bong St and Kirkham Rd in both directions
  • Wingecarribee St between Kirkham Rd and Station St from 4:00am to 10:00am

FROM 7AM TO 8:45AM

  • Oxleys Hill Rd will be closed for all traffic from 7:00am – 8:45am. Use Centennial Rd during this time.

BUNDANOON

FROM 7:30AM TO 10:30AM

  • Ellsmore Rd, Bundanoon will be closed to Northbound Traffic between Blue Gum Rd and Sallys Corner Rd from 7:30am – 10:30am.Use Bundanoon Rd and Middle Rd during this time.

FITZROY FALLS

FROM 8:45AM TO 12:30PM

  • Nowra Rd to Myra Vale Rd closed to all though traffic between Yarrawa Rd and Sheepwash Rd.Cars travelling north-west will be restricted. Local access for traffic south-east bound.Detours in place 8:45am to 12:30pm. 

FROM 8:30AM TO 1PM

  • Myra Vale Rd and Pearsons Ln closed to southbound traffic between Nowra Rd and Illawarra Hwy. Local access for northbound traffic only.Detours in place 8:30am to 1:00pm.

KANGALOON 

FROM 9AM TO 2:15PM

  • Tourist Rd/Kirkland Rd closed to south/eastbound traffic between Range Rd and Kangaloon Rd to Robertson.Local access for north/ westbound traffic.Detours in place between 9am and 2:15pm. 

GLENQUARRY/MITTAGONG

FROM 9:30AM TO 2:30PM

  • Range Rd closed to south/eastbound traffic between Old South Rd and Tourist Rd.Local access for north/westbound traffic.Detours in place between 9:30am and 2:30pm.

properties.headline: BBL - Sunday 5 December - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: 2021 Moore Park transport and walking map mar21.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Melbourne Stars at the SCG. Start from 7.35pm, finish around 10:25pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. Motorists travelling south on the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax grass car park near Moore Park Rd will not open for this event. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Cleveland Street* between City Road and South Dowling Street
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)

*existing clearways on Cleveland St will be extended to 11pm.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

webLinks.linkText: 2021 Cobar Christmas Festival and Street Parade

properties.headline: Street parade - Friday 3 December - COBAR Marshall Street/Barrier Highway between Lewis Street AND Barton Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 2021 Cobar Christmas Festival and Street Parade along Marshall St/Barrier Hwy.

To accommodate the event Marshall St/Barrier Hwy will close between Lewis St and Barton St/Frederick St from 5pm until 9pm. Motorists will be detoured via Louth Rd. 

Motorists should allow additional travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Christmas event - Saturday 4 December - MERRIWA Golden Highway between Marquet St AND Dutton St
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Merriwa Street Christmas Party will be taking place on Saturday 4 December from 12pm to 9pm.

To accommodate the event the Golden Hwy will be closed between Dutton St and Marquet St from 12pm to 9pm. Motorists will be detoured around the highway closure via Marquet St, Blaxland St and Dutton St.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic control on site.

properties.headline: Festival - Friday 3 to Sunday 12 December - GRAFTON Pound Street between Prince Street AND Duke Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Grafton Jacaranda Festival will take place from Friday 3 to Sunday 12 December at various venues in Grafton. 

On Thursday 9 December from 6am until 5pm Pound St between Prince St and Duke St will be closed for the annual market store day and street parade. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time throughout the duration of the festival and be aware of increased pedestrian activity, particularly over the weekends when large crowds are expected.

properties.headline: Soccer match - Wednesday 1 December - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FFA Cup: Wollongong Wolves v Central Coast Mariners from 7:30pm until 9:15pm approx at WIN Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game during Wednesday evening peak.

Road closures will be in place before kick off on sections of Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St, and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 27 November - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Macarthur FC at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick off from 7.45pm, full-time 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Local roads around the stadium will close before the game including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: A-League - Saturday 27 November - WOLLONGONG Harbour Street and Burelli Street at WIN Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Wellington Phoenix v Central Coast Mariners at WIN Stadium. Kick off from 5pm, full-time from 6.50pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the area including Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Road closures will be in place before kick off on sections of Harbour St between Stewart St and Crown St, and Burelli St between Corrimal St and Harbour St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Attendees driving to events should allow extra time for parking.

properties.headline: Race Day - Saturday 27 November - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Festival Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates open from 11:15am, first race from 12:20pm and last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.
